refnamediv.refpurpose: returns a varchar containing the body of the request uri

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: http_get returns a varchar containing the body of the requested target_uri or NULL if the body is not received.

refsect2.title: target_uri
refsect2.para: HTTP target in form http://<target_host>:<target_port>/<path> (if <target_port> is not given then 80 will be used by default)

refsect2.title: return_header
refsect2.para: This output parameter is set to the array of HTTP response header lines from the target server, if the parameter is a constant it will be ignored.

refsect2.title: http_method
refsect2.para: This parameter will be used to specify the HTTP request method. Possible values are: GET, POST, PUT, OPTIONS or see RFC2616[5.1.1] for details.

refsect2.title: request_header
refsect2.para: This string will be sent to the target server together with other header fields. If more than one header field should be sent then header fields must be separated with CR/LF pair. (Warning: this string must not be terminated with CR/LF pair!).

refsect2.title: request_body
refsect2.para: This string will be sent to the target server as the request body. The "Content-Length" header field is set to the length of this string.

refsect2.title: proxy
refsect2.para: If this parameter is supplied the request will be passed through this HTTP proxy. The format is <proxy_host>:<proxy_port> .
In the INI file, in section HTTPServer should be set:
Exception could be also 127.0.0.* i.e. there could have also wildcard.
